alert.note: Alert for Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 12:45PM EST until February 17 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Clinch River Near Richlands affecting Tazewell County. For the Clinch River...including Richlands...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinch River Near Richlands. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, the river begins to affect the water treatment plant. Portions of Clinch River Road, Matney Lane, Allegheny Street and 4th Street are flooded and impassible until the river recedes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Friday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 11.3 feet early this afternoon, and will then gradually recede, falling below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed.
